Dating: 22ND DYNASTY (not before); 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD; 24TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Funerary cone of Djedher
Description: Funerary cone with an inscription of six horizontal lines. It belonged to Djedher, son of Ankh-Hor, and his mother was called Shepensepedet. His family was of good lineage and was related to a great chief of the Meshwesh, a Lybian tribe living in Egypt, which was later to found the 22nd Dynasty. The cone is formed like a small drum and shows remnants of white paint.
